name: David Letterman
monologue: The volcanic ash cloud from Iceland is making its way to the U.S. and actually improving the air quality in New York City. I’ve been coughing up lava all day.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: One good thing came out of this volcano in Iceland. Economists say consumers can expect a huge drop in the price of lava lamps.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: President Obama gave a speech in New York about his plans to reform the rules for Wall St. A lot of Wall St. executives were shaking in their boots when the president showed up. The bad news is, they were $800 Italian leather boots that were bought with our bailout money.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Spirit Airlines announced it’s going to install non-reclining seats in their airplanes. They came up with this last month after they saw a passenger that looked comfortable.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: These are the same people that are charging $45 for a carry-on bag. Maybe Spirit Airlines should change their name to “Mean-Spirited Airlines.”
